title: Ancelotti made history : FIFA Intercontinental Cup for Real Madrid .
body_text:
Ancelotti made history: FIFA Intercontinental Cup for Real Madrid.
18.12.2024 22:30
In the FIFA Intercontinental Cup final, Real Madrid defeated Mexican representative Pachuca 3-0 to claim the trophy. Meanwhile, Carlo Ancelotti, who won his 15th trophy at the helm of the Spanish giant, became the coach with the most trophies in the history of the Madrid team. Our national player Arda Güler, who came on in the 88th minute, won the 6th trophy of his career.
In the final of the FIFA Intercontinental Cup held in Qatar, Real Madrid faced the Mexican team Pachuca. Real Madrid won the match played at Lusail Stadium 3-0 and became the owner of the cup.
ARDA GÜLER ENTERED IN THE 88TH MINUTE
The goals that brought the cup to the Spanish giant were scored by Kylian Mbappe in the 37th minute, Rodygo in the 53rd minute, and Vinicius Junior from a penalty in the 84th minute. Our national football player Arda Güler started the match on the bench and was included in the game in the 88th minute.
ANCELOTTI MADE HISTORY
With this result, Carlo Ancelotti, who won his 15th cup with Real Madrid, managed to inscribe his name in history as the coach with the most cups won at the Madrid club.
ARDA WON HIS 6TH CUP IN HIS CAREER
Our national football player Arda Güler, who transferred to Real Madrid in the summer of 2023, quickly achieved his 5th cup in his Real Madrid career. The 19-year-old player added the UEFA Champions League, UEFA Super Cup, La Liga championship, Spain Super Cup, and FIFA Intercontinental Cup championship to his career with the Real Madrid jersey. Additionally, Arda also has a Turkish Cup championship with the Fenerbahçe jersey.
HOW DID THEY REACH THE FINAL?
The five-match tournament featuring the champions of the 6 confederations affiliated with FIFA began on September 22, 2023.
In the playoff match played in the United Arab Emirates, Al-Ain, the champion of the Asian Football Confederation (AFC) Champions League, defeated Auckland City, the champion of the Oceania Football Confederation (OFC) Champions League, 6-2 to advance to the next round.
In the "FIFA Africa-Asia-Pacific Cup" match played in Egypt on October 29, Al-Ahly, the champion of the African Football Confederation (CAF) Champions League, advanced to the next round by defeating Al-Ain 3-0.
In the "FIFA America Derby" match played in Doha on December 11, Pachuca, the champion of the CONCACAF Champions Cup, defeated Botafogo, the champion of the South American Football Confederation (CONMEBOL) Copa Libertadores, 3-0 to advance to the next round.
In the "FIFA Challenger Cup" match held at Stadium 974 in Doha on December 15, which ended goalless after normal time and extra time, Pachuca became the team that advanced to the final by winning 4-3 on penalties against Al-Ahly.
With this result, Pachuca, the champion of the CONCACAF Champions Cup, became the opponent of Real Madrid, the champion of the UEFA Champions League, in the final to be played on December 18 at Lusail Stadium in Doha, the capital of Qatar.
